content:
*even though earlier calibration was valid, the second calibration was done by the state DISCOM

ORPPL

Meter Meter Number Accuracy 1Â° calibration class Calibration date | Calibration due date GSS Main Meter ASH13815 0.2s 03-July-2012 02-July-2017 GSS Check meter ASH13816 0.2s 03-July-2012 02-July-2017

All the calibration dates, meter number and accuracy are verified from the calibration reports IPA/ and found to be correct. The meter numbers & accuracy class of energy meters are reconfirmed during site visit. The monitoring period falls within 5 years of the initial calibration date. Hence, the calibration done for the energy meters is valid for throughout the monitoring period.

w

17

The accuracy class of energy meters installed in the project is 0.2s which is more accuracy class than the minimum accuracy class mentioned in the validated VCS PD ie, 0.5s. Hence, the accuracy of energy meters installed is found to be OK.

The validation team conclude that the evidence used to determine the emission reduction is of sufficient quantity and appropriate quality. Hence the emission reduction calculated for the monitoring period is accurate.
